stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream fixing Blender / Fast64 pipeline issues, imports a Luigi model, tweaks volcano-area geometry for the overworld, and shows a new “exit-course” menu. He confirms Course 7 is in external beta, talks ROM size, and sketches plans for side levels and a dynamic overworld.

development_findings.summary: Course 7 is functionally complete, has been sent to outside testers, and already runs correctly on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I finished most of course 7 and I set it out for a beta test. It fully works on real N64, which is amazing.

development_findings.summary: A post-star dialog now lets players choose to remain in the course or return to the overworld, replacing the forced stay from the demo.
development_findings.quote: Do you want to return to the overworld? Stay or leave? If you hit leave, it pops you out. Isn’t that cool?

development_findings.summary: Current ROM size is 59.953 MB; the team intends to stay at or below the 64 MB limit.
development_findings.quote: The game has a good chance of being done by the end of the year… The exact number is 59.953.

development_findings.summary: Kaze imported a fully modelled Luigi; co-op is being considered but no final design decision has been made.
development_findings.quote: Co-op confirmed? Well, I'm not 100 % sure exactly how Luigi ties into this yet.

development_findings.summary: First-pass overworld pieces will remain separate; later Kaze will merge them into one large map that streams sectors dynamically to handle objects visible from multiple areas.
development_findings.quote: After your pass is done, I'm going to make this all into one big level that loads dynamically as you walk through it.

development_findings.summary: Side-level concept: an oil-tanker infiltration mission that unlocks Oily Body Bay; side levels should take ‘a day or two’ each to build and will host five bosses altogether.
development_findings.quote: There’s an oil tanker full of enemies… entering the tanker warps you to Oily Body Bay. That sounds like a side level.

development_findings.summary: Blender 4.1 causes extreme slow-downs; installing the new F64 renderer add-on drops CPU usage to near-zero but introduces decal-depth and transparency inaccuracies.
development_findings.quote: So far it’s kind of goated… but I still don’t see a clip through. I think the decal emulation quantizes the depth down too much.

development_findings.summary: A Fast64 setting (‘write all’ without ‘bleed’) was silently re-enabling on file reload, turning Mario’s hair white; Kaze removed the JSON line and will enable the flag per-file.
development_findings.quote: The option that breaks if you don’t have bleed activated turns itself on whenever you open the file.

development_findings.summary: Engine rewrites plus use of the low-level LVP renderer yield ‘basically perfect FPS’ on console.
development_findings.quote: LVP is significantly faster than the RDP… basically perfect FPS.

development_findings.summary: Kaze expects the hack to run on the upcoming Analogue 3D; coordination with Wiseguy’s toolchain is planned.
development_findings.quote: I’m very interested to see if this will run on the Analogue. Wiseguy seems pretty confident that it will work.

context_findings.summary: Kaze will have two weeks off work in roughly two weeks and plans daily streams to finish the overworld.
context_findings.quote: In two weeks, I’ll be off work, so there might be a full two weeks of streams. We will probably finish the overworld in those two weeks.

context_findings.summary: He upgraded to Windows 11 for security reasons but finds it buggy (multiple hangs and blue screens).
context_findings.quote: It truly is a comedy how buggy Windows 11 has been so far.

context_findings.summary: Finances: streams generate little income compared to videos; he contemplates YouTube sponsorship for F3 and notes he could earn ~US$60–70 k annually from videos alone.
context_findings.quote: If I just made YouTube videos, maybe like 60,000–70,000 a year… but I don’t want to.

context_findings.summary: Expresses preference for personalised ads and delivers mock-threat humor toward Lilaa; overall tone is playful despite frustration.
Mentions recent weight loss and associated strength loss; bug bites from outdoor work; casual life updates.

biobak.summary: Encouraged Kaze to install the Fast64 renderer add-on to improve performance.

zeina.summary: Joins chat briefly; no project update provided.

key_stories.title: The ‘Write All’ Hair Nightmare
key_stories.summary: Mario’s hair kept disappearing in exports. Kaze discovered the Fast64 ‘write all’ flag was auto-reactivating on every file load when ‘bleed’ was off. After live debugging with Lilaa he removed the flag from global repo settings and now enables it only in files that need it.
key_stories.challenge: Character model exported with missing hair and other anomalies.
key_stories.process: Tested combinations of ‘write all’ and ‘bleed’, inspected repo JSON, consulted Lilaa, and edited the settings file live on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Hair renders correctly; Kaze realises previous mysterious bugs were likely caused by the auto-resetting flag.
key_stories.key_quote: No wonder I kept getting bugs. It’s because that turns itself on over and over.

key_stories.title: Fast64 Renderer Performance Pivot
key_stories.summary: Blender 4.1 became unusably slow. Chat (notably Biobak and Lilaa) urged Kaze to try the new F64 renderer. After initial reluctance, he installed it, saw CPU usage plummet, but noticed decal inaccuracies that will need fixing.
key_stories.challenge: Severe lag in Blender when editing the overworld.
key_stories.process: Benchmarked CPU use, installed the renderer via ‘Install from Disk’, compared Eevee vs F64 outputs.
key_stories.outcome: Editor is usable again; a new bug list (decal depth, transparency) is born.
key_stories.key_quote: Wait, maybe we have to take back the death threats—Lilaa was right.

key_stories.title: Luigi Appears
key_stories.summary: Kaze imported a high-quality Luigi model. The community instantly speculated about co-op. Kaze likes the idea but hasn’t planned how Luigi fits into the game.
key_stories.challenge: Integrating a second playable character without design groundwork.
key_stories.process: Model import, quick in-engine test, live brainstorming with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Feature is officially ‘on the table’; no technical work yet.
key_stories.key_quote: Co-op would be the coolest option.
